iaik.utils

Class IAIKPasswordStore

  • java.lang.Object
    • iaik.utils.IAIKPasswordStore
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Externalizable, java.io.Serializable

    public final class IAIKPasswordStore
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Externalizable
    This class implements a password store, which can be used in a similar fashion as JCE key stores. It uses AES and CMAC/AES in combination with PBKDF2 to securely store the password data.
    See Also:
    PBKDF2, Rijndael, CMacAES, PasswordGenerator, PasswordStrengthChecker, Serialized Form

      • load

        public void load(java.lang.String filename,
        char[] password)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Loads a key store from a file. Note the password is being copied. Hence, the user has to take care of clearing it.
        Parameters:
        filename - the file name
        password - the password to decrypt this key store
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown, if a file format error occurred

      • load

          throws java.io.IOException
        Loads a key store from a file. Note the password is being copied. Hence, the user has to take care of clearing it.
        Parameters:
        file - the file
        password - the password to decrypt this key store
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown, if the file could not be read or if a file format error occurred

      • store

        public void store(java.lang.String filename,
         char[] password)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Encrypts the current state of this key store and stores it to a file. Note the password is being copied. Hence, the user has to take care of clearing it.
        Parameters:
        filename - the file name
        password - the password to be used to encrypt the key store
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown, if the file could not be written

      • store

        public void store(java.io.OutputStream out,
         char[] password)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Encrypts the current state of this key store and stores it to an output stream. Note the password is being copied. Hence, the user has to take care of clearing it.
        Parameters:
        out - the output stream
        password - the password to be used to encrypt the key store
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown, if the file could not be written

      • getPassword

        public char[] getPassword(java.lang.String alias)
        Returns the stored password for some alias.
        Parameters:
        alias - the alias
        Returns:
        the corresponding password

      • setPasswordEntry

        public void setPasswordEntry(java.lang.String alias,
                    char[] password)
        Creates a new password entry consisting of an alias and the password. Note the password is being copied. Hence, the user has to take care of clearing it.
        Parameters:
        alias - the alias for identifying this entry
        password - the password as character array

      • generatePasswordEntry

        public char[] generatePasswordEntry(java.lang.String alias,
                           int length,
                           int usedSymbolMask)
        Creates a new password entry consisting of an alias and a generated password. The user can specify the password length and the character sets to be used.
        Parameters:
        alias - the alias for identifying this entry
        length - the password length
        usedSymbolMask - the symbol mask for determining the character set, which is an OR-combination of the values USE_CHARS_LOWER, USE_CHARS_UPPER, USE_NUMBERS, USE_SPECIAL_BASIC, and USE_SPECIAL_EXTENDED from PasswordGenerator
        Returns:
        the generated password as character array
        See Also:
        PasswordGenerator

      • containsAlias

        public boolean containsAlias(java.lang.String alias)
        Returns true, if the password store contains an entry for some alias.
        Parameters:
        alias - the alias
        Returns:
        true, iff the password contains the corresponding entry

        public void deleteEntry(java.lang.String alias)
